title: Watch cattle flee as California wildfire rages
description: Wildfires are blazing in 13 states across the the US, burning more than 1 million acres in western states, according to the National Interagency Fire Center.

title: Analysis: What are the odds Biden can un-stall the rest of his agenda?
description: We're six months into the Joe Biden presidency. The President is set to take part in a CNN Town Hall to be broadcast live at 8 p.m. ET Wednesday night in Cincinnati, Ohio.

title: Brazil's scandal-plagued President may face a reckoning as lawmakers consider impeachment
description: Corruption inquiries, a spreading Covid-19 crisis, plunging popularity and persistent bouts of hiccups. Brazil's scandal-plagued President Jair Bolsonaro just can't seem to catch a break.

title: Why the Delta variant is spreading so much faster than other coronavirus strains
description: Worldwide, there is an alarming surge in coronavirus cases -- and health experts say  a key factor in this latest wave is the highly contagious Delta variant.

title: Perseverance rover prepares to collect Martian samples that will be sent to Earth
description: Almost a year after NASA's Perseverance rover was launched on its nearly seven-month journey to Mars, the robotic explorer is preparing to collect its first Martian sample within the next two weeks.

title: 'I'm sorry, but it's too late': Doctor says unvaccinated Covid patients beg for vaccine
description: An Alabama doctor shared a heartbreaking Facebook post, revealing that some of her unvaccinated Covid-19 patients are begging for the vaccine before being placed on a ventilator.

title: Harvey Weinstein, in a wheelchair, pleads not guilty to sexual assault charges in Los Angeles
description: Disgraced movie producer Harvey Weinstein pleaded not guilty to 11 sexual assault charges in a Los Angeles courtroom on Wednesday, a day after he was moved across the country from his New York prison.

title: US and Germany reach deal on controversial pipeline that Biden sees as a Russian 'geopolitical project'
description: The US announced Wednesday that it has reached a deal with Germany that would allow completion of the controversial Nord Stream 2 pipeline opposed by the Biden administration as a "malign influence project" that Russia could use to gain leverage over European allies.

title: US Women's National Team hammered by Sweden in opening Tokyo 2020 match
description: Sweden laid down an early marker in the women's Olympic football competition, hammering the US Women's National Team 3-0 on Wednesday.

title: Biden names ambassadors to Canada, Slovenia and Austria
description: President Joe Biden has selected another round of ambassadors, including choices for posts in Canada, Slovenia and Austria.

title: 'The Last Duel' trailer is here with Matt Damon, Adam Driver, Jodie Comer and Ben Affleck
description: The first trailer for "The Last Duel," Ridley Scott's period drama, has debuted.

title: Around 100 kidnapped women and children rescued in Nigeria
description: Around 100 women and children abducted in early June by gunmen known locally as "bandits" have been rescued, police authorities in Nigeria's northwestern Zamfara State said.

title: Argentina creates an ID for nonbinary people
description: Argentina's President Alberto Fernandez announced a new National Identity Document (DNI) for nonbinary people on Wednesday.

title: McCarthy pulls his 5 GOP picks from Capitol riot committee
description: • Biden CNN town hall at 8 p.m. ET: How to watch | 5 key things

title: 'Disgraceful': Liz Cheney fires back after McCarthy's move
description: Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) blasted House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy's (R-CA) decision to pull all Republicans from the select committee investigating the January 6 attack on the Capitol.

title: Look back at some of Prince George's cutest moments
description: As Prince George turns eight, we look back at some of his cutest moments.

title: Long-awaited $800M museum opens in Berlin
description: The Humboldt Forum, a vast new museum complex in a partial reconstruction of the Prussian royal palace in the center of Berlin, opened Tuesday after almost two years of postponements caused first by construction delays, then by Covid-19.

title: Men have a bigger carbon footprint than women. This is why
description: Gender stereotypes are alive and well and harming our planet, a new study from Sweden shows, as men's passion for meat and cars is making them bigger contributors to greenhouse gases than women.

title: 'Fire is massive': Russian firefighter on raging Siberian blazes
description: Wildfires have razed hundreds of thousands of hectares in Russia's Siberia amid a combination of abnormally warm weather and droughts. CNN's Kim Brunhuber reports.

title: Netherlands thrashes Zambia 10-3 in women's football tournament to set new Olympics record
description: The Netherlands thrashed Zambia 10-3 to break the record for the most goals scored by a single team in a women's Olympic football match.

title: Water crisis protests reportedly continue in Iran, with chants in capital
description: Street protests over water shortages in southwest Iran continued for a sixth night on Tuesday amid rising violence, while residents in the capital of Tehran chanted anti-government slogans, according to videos posted on social media on Wednesday and Iranian news outlets.

title: This group of children is up to 10 times more likely to drown than others, a report finds
description: Drowning is one of the leading causes of unintentional injury-related death for children ages 1 to 19 in the United States, but some children have a significantly higher chance of drowning than others.

title: The towering pile of concrete and debris from Florida condo collapse now nearly an empty pit
description: Nearly four weeks ago, search and rescue crews were faced with a mountain of concrete rubble and twisted metal as they tried to find the victims of the Surfside condo building collapse.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene was asked a simple question. Her answer was revealing
description: On Tuesday, Georgia Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene was asked a simple question. Her answer was, uh, revealing.

title: Passengers trapped inside submerged subway as deadly floods sweep central China
Hungary plans referendum on law criticized by EU as homophobic
description: Hungary's right-wing populist Prime Minister Viktor Orbán has proposed a referendum on the country's controversial new LGBTQ law. The move is in response to the European Union which lambasted the new measure by the member state.

title: I got vaccinated in a drugstore. My unvaccinated uncle died of Covid-19 because of where he lives
Olympic athletes battling long Covid: 'I'm really struggling to exercise still'
Liverpool stripped of its UNESCO World Heritage listing
description: It's famous for its docks, the Beatles, and its two world-renowned soccer teams -- but now, Liverpool is going through a different kind of notoriety.

title: Khloe Kardashian on raising her biracial child as a White mom
description: Khloe Kardashian is the mother of a biracial child and wants to fully embrace that.

title: Dolly Parton recreates iconic Playboy cover
description: The 75-year-old country singer surprised her husband Carl by recreating her original Playboy cover from the 70s.

title: Ted Cruz is blocking diplomats from being confirmed
description: An extraordinary effort by Republican Sen. Ted Cruz of Texas to block nominees from being confirmed to vital jobs in the State Department is creating hurdles for the Biden administration and hindering US diplomacy, according to Democrats and Republicans who spoke to CNN.

title: Why Netflix isn't pressing the panic button
description: Netflix lost 433,000 subscribers in the United States and Canada during the second quarter, according to financial results issued after the bell on Tuesday.

title: Brisbane officially announced as host of 2032 Olympics
description: Brisbane has been officially announced as host of the Olympic and Paralympic Games in 2032.

title: Pfizer to make Covid vaccines in South Africa
description: Pfizer and BioNTech will start to manufacture their Covid-19 vaccine in South Africa, they announced jointly on Wednesday, in a move that could significantly increase the availability of doses across the continent next year.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo wants his NBA Finals heroics to inspire others to 'believe in their dreams'
description: It's been a long journey to the very top of basketball for Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: Personal threats, election lies and punishing new laws rattle election officials, raising fears of a mass exodus
description: Maribeth Witzel-Behl had run elections in Madison, Wisconsin, for 15 years when the 2020 election arrived, bringing challenges like no other: a global pandemic, a crushing workload, lawsuits and a recount.

title: China debuts world's fastest train
description: A maglev bullet train that can reach speeds of 600 kilometers per hour (373 miles per hour) has made its debut in Qingdao, China.

title: 'Donation of the century': South Korea unveils late Samsung boss' 23,000-strong art collection
description: Museum visitors have been given a first look at some of the 23,000 artworks donated to South Korea from the collection of Samsung's late chairman, Lee Kun-hee.

title: Bezos donates $100 million each to CNN contributor Van Jones and chef Jose Andres
description: Jeff Bezos, the Amazon founder and world's wealthiest man, said Tuesday after flying to the edge of space that he planned to award $100 million each to CNN contributor Van Jones and chef José Andrés.

title: Top CEO: Losses from no-fan Olympics will be 'enormous'
description: One of Japan's most prominent business leaders says the Olympics are losing their commercial value.

title: Can a motorcycle-hailing company create an African super app?
description: Super apps have taken off in Asia, with users able to book flights, reserve hotels, play games and more all in one place.

title: Gender reveal party couple face jail over deadly wildfire
description: A Southern California couple whose gender reveal party allegedly sparked the deadly El Dorado wildfire in 2020 has been charged with 30 crimes, including involuntary manslaughter, authorities announced Tuesday.

title: Olympic athletes battling long Covid: 'I'm really struggling'
description: Oonagh Cousins was training up to 35 hours a week after she was picked for the British rowing team for the Tokyo Olympics, despite contracting Covid-19 in February 2020.

title: Russian mercenaries caught on harrowing videos killing construction worker
description: In the central Syrian desert, an oil field has become a makeshift torture chamber. An unarmed man writhes in the dust, howling in pain. Four men in military fatigues pin him down and smash his hands and feet with a sledgehammer.

title: When China opens borders, some may be wary of visiting
description: Last week, the Biden administration warned American companies about the risk of doing business in Hong Kong, citing Beijing's increasing crackdown on the city.

title: Red and processed meat linked to heart disease, mega study says
description: Eating beef, lamb, pork and processed meats will increase your risk of coronary heart disease later in life, according to a new meta-analysis of studies on over 1.4 million people who were followed for 30 years.

title: An Olympic dream crushed, an elite career derailed
description: World Athletics' rules on natural testosterone levels have barred some women from competition. Meet two elite athletes who are fighting for acceptance.

title: Indonesia is now the epicenter of Asia's Covid-19 crisis. Here's what you need to know
description: For much of last year, it seemed like Indonesia had managed to keep its Covid-19 outbreak largely under control.

title: Milwaukee Bucks are NBA champions for the first time since 1971
description: The Milwaukee Bucks won their first NBA championship in 50 years, downing the Phoenix Suns 105-98 in Tuesday's Game 6 of the NBA Finals in Milwaukee.

title: Man flees Australian Covid quarantine using a bed sheet
description: A 39-year-old man allegedly used a rope made from bed sheets to shimmy down from a fourth floor hotel room and flee Australian quarantine, police said.

title: Tokyo Olympics underway despite threat of Covid-19
description: After a delay of more than a year due to the pandemic, the Tokyo 2020 Summer Olympics are finally underway.

title: Watch gymnast disprove myth about Olympic beds
description: The myriad of anti-Covid rules at the Tokyo 2020 Olymics are putting a damper on the usual fanfare and celebration of the event. CNN's Blake Essig reports.

title: I got vaccinated in a US drugstore. My unvaccinated uncle died of Covid.
description: Every time I see a call from home, my heart sinks. I always fear that they're ringing to say that my grandmother has died. She has been on a ventilator for four weeks and my anxiety is near breaking point. The dreaded call could come at any time: Covid-19. Again.

title: Biden's crisis presidency will only get harder as it passes the six-month mark
description: President Joe Biden said Tuesday the nation's vaccine push feels like a "constant uphill climb." He could have said the same of his entire crisis-tossed presidency as it grinds past the six-month mark.

title: Company tests self-driving cars in New York City for the first time
description: Mobileye, an Israeli self-driving technology company owned by Intel, has become the first company to test fully self-driving cars on New York City's streets.

title: Businessman indicted on lobbying charges counted Trump among his 'closest friends'
description: The illegal foreign lobbying charges brought against Tom Barrack on Tuesday punctuate a winding business and political career defined by his unique staying power in former President Donald Trump's constantly shifting orbit of advisers.

title: Bride dances too hard to Dave Matthews Band and dislocates her knee
description: A bride's first dance was a doozy as she dislocated a knee at her wedding. Here comes the bride ... to the ER. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Nxivm founder to pay victims almost $3.5 million in restitution
description: A federal judge ruled that 21 people should receive a total of $3.46 million in restitution from Keith Raniere, the founder of Nxivm, for being victims of his racketeering, sex trafficking and forced labor crimes.

title: Bill Clinton turned down tea with the Queen to 'be a tourist' and eat Indian food
description: Former US President Bill Clinton declined offers of tea with Queen Elizabeth and dinner at the British Prime Minister's official country house because he wanted to "be a tourist," go shopping and eat Indian food during his first official visit to the UK with Tony Blair as leader in 1997, according to formerly classified documents.

title: 'I'm learning how language has failed me': Author on grieving her father's death
description: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, author of "Notes on Grief," talks to CNN's Christiane Amanpour about coping with the loss of her parents. Her father died in 2020 and she lost her mother in March.
